rules.natural: If water pollution causes habitat loss, then habitat loss causes disease outbreaks.
If the health agency detects contamination, then should the health agency monitor water quality, the health agency intervenes through government action.
If the health agency uses field sensors, then the health agency detects contamination.
The health agency uses field sensors or the health agency uses satellite imagery.
If the health agency uses satellite imagery, then the health agency detects contamination.
If the government approves cleanup funds, then provided that the health agency implements water treatment, the water source does not contain pollutants.
The government approves cleanup funds or the opposition party delays cleanup funds.
If the opposition party delays cleanup funds, then the opposition party rejects cleanup funds.
If the opposition party rejects cleanup funds, then given that the health agency implements water treatment, the water source does not contain pollutants.
If the community relocates to a safe zone, then the community does not evacuate the risk zone.
If the health agency declares a state of emergency, then should the health agency not intervene through government action, the community relocates to a safe zone.
The health agency declares a state of emergency or the local government declares a state of emergency.
If habitat loss causes disease outbreaks, then the health agency intervenes through government action.
If the local government declares a state of emergency, then provided that the health agency does not intervene through government action, the community relocates to a safe zone.
If the editor assigns a journalist, then the media publishes an investigation report.
The editor assigns a journalist or a freelancer is assigned as a journalist.
If a freelancer is assigned as a journalist, then should the media investigate contamination, the media escalates public awareness.
The water source contains pollutants or the health agency intervenes through government action.
If water treatment requires funding, then provided that the health agency implements water treatment, the water source does not contain pollutants.
If the health agency issues a health advisory, then under the condition that the health agency does not intervene through government action, the community does not evacuate the risk zone.
If the health agency holds a press conference, then the health agency issues a health advisory.
The health agency holds a press conference or the health agency distributes public notices.
If it is not the case that the health agency monitoring water quality results in the health agency intervening through government action, then the media investigates contamination.
If it is not the case that the health agency monitoring water quality triggers the health agency intervening through government action, then the media does not escalate public awareness.
If it is not the case that the health agency distributing public notices leads to the health agency issuing a health advisory, then the public becomes confused by mixed messages.
If it is not the case that the health agency distributing public notices results in the health agency issuing a health advisory, then the public does not become confused by mixed messages.
If the health agency does not intervene through government action, then the community evacuates the risk zone.

(A1 → A2).natural: If water pollution causes habitat loss, then habitat loss causes disease outbreaks.

(A1 → G).natural: If water pollution causes habitat loss, then the health agency intervenes through government action.

(A11 → G).natural: If the health agency monitors water quality, then the health agency intervenes through government action.

(A12 → (A11 → G)).natural: If the health agency detects contamination, then should the health agency monitor water quality, the health agency intervenes through government action.

(A13 → A12).natural: If the health agency uses field sensors, then the health agency detects contamination.

(A13 ∨ A14).natural: The health agency uses field sensors or the health agency uses satellite imagery.

(A14 → A12).natural: If the health agency uses satellite imagery, then the health agency detects contamination.

(A15 → (A4 → ¬A3)).natural: If the government approves cleanup funds, then provided that the health agency implements water treatment, the water source does not contain pollutants.

(A17 → (A4 → ¬A3)).natural: If the opposition party rejects cleanup funds, then given that the health agency implements water treatment, the water source does not contain pollutants.

(A18 → ¬A6).natural: If the community relocates to a safe zone, then the community does not evacuate the risk zone.

(A2 → G).natural: If habitat loss causes disease outbreaks, then the health agency intervenes through government action.

(A20 → (¬G → A18)).natural: If the local government declares a state of emergency, then provided that the health agency does not intervene through government action, the community relocates to a safe zone.

(A22 → A21).natural: If the media investigates contamination, then the media escalates public awareness.

(A24 → A23).natural: If the editor assigns a journalist, then the media publishes an investigation report.

(A3 ∨ G).natural: The water source contains pollutants or the health agency intervenes through government action.

(A4 → ¬A3).natural: If the health agency implements water treatment, then the water source does not contain pollutants.

(A7 → (¬G → ¬A6)).natural: If the health agency issues a health advisory, then under the condition that the health agency does not intervene through government action, the community does not evacuate the risk zone.

(A8 → A7).natural: If the health agency holds a press conference, then the health agency issues a health advisory.

(A8 ∨ A9).natural: The health agency holds a press conference or the health agency distributes public notices.
